result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassandra A. CAIN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Comply with Sex Offender Registry.

Comply with Sex Offender Treatment and follow through.

Have no contact with the victim. 

Have no contact with anyone under the age of 18 without agent's approval and with the exception of her own biological children or grandchildren.  

Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

timeConds.notes:
Six (6) months, up front under the Huber Law.  
Six (6) months, stayed, to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
The Court hereby orders that defendant's bail is modified to change the provisions involving no contact with anyone under the age of 18 to no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18.
Copy to jail.

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.   Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-14-15 at 2:00 p.m.   Court orders defendant to submit DNA sample.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.    
Minutes.

Amended Criminal Complaint charges the defendant with 1 ct. Repeated Sexual Assault of Child, contrary to Section 948.025(1)(e) and 1 ct. Child Enticement, contrary to Section 948.07(1) of the Wisconsin Statutes.
Anthony Lambrecht, Public Defender.

ADDRESS INFO for Cassandra A. CAIN
Current: 5925 Fisherville Road, Whitelaw, WI 54247 United States  (Effective: 08-18-2015)
Prior: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

$500.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-26-15 at 1:30 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2nd degree sexual assault of child, child enticement, repeated sexual assault of same child.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-17-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that she report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and have no contact with C.J.L, DOB: 01-21-2000 and no contact with anyone under the age of 18 years old except her own biological children.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.
Minutes.
